de.mslab.ciphers

Interface BlockCipher

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RoundBasedBlockCipher, TweakableCipher
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AES, AES128, AES192, AES256, ARIA, ARIA128, ARIA192, ARIA256, BKSQ144, BKSQ192, BKSQ96, Groestl256Permutation, Groestl512Permutation, GroestlPermutation, Khazad, KLEIN64, KLEIN80, KLEIN96, LBlock, LED, LED112, LED128, LED64, LED80, LED96, MCrypton, MCrypton128, MCrypton64, MCrypton96, PRESENT, PRESENT128, PRESENT80, PRINCE, PRINCECore, Serpent, SQUARE, ThreeFish, ThreeFish1024, ThreeFish256, ThreeFish512, WhirlpoolCipher

    public interface BlockCipher
    Interface for all symmetric ciphers.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ByteArray decrypt(ByteArray block)
      Performs a full-cipher decryption of the given block with the current key.
      ByteArray encrypt(ByteArray block)
      Performs a full-cipher encryption of the given block with the current key.
      ByteArray getExpandedKey()
      Returns a byte array which represents the expanded key with all subkeys.
      int getKeySize()
      Returns the size in bytes of the secret key for this cipher.
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the name of this cipher.
      int getStateSize()
      Returns the block size in bytes for this cipher.
      boolean operatesBytewise()
      Returns true, if the cipher operates byte-wise.
      boolean operatesColumnwise()
      Returns true, if the cipher operates byte-wise and column-wise.
      boolean operatesNibblewise()
      Returns true, if the cipher operates nibble-wise.
      void setExpandedKey(ByteArray expandedKey)
      Sets the expanded key with all round keys.
      void setKey(ByteArray key)
      Sets the secret key used for encryption and decryption.

    • Method Detail

      • decrypt

        ByteArray decrypt(ByteArray block)
        Performs a full-cipher decryption of the given block with the current key.

      • encrypt

        ByteArray encrypt(ByteArray block)
        Performs a full-cipher encryption of the given block with the current key.

      • getExpandedKey

        ByteArray getExpandedKey()
        Returns a byte array which represents the expanded key with all subkeys.

      • getKeySize

        int getKeySize()
        Returns the size in bytes of the secret key for this cipher.

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name of this cipher.

      • getStateSize

        int getStateSize()
        Returns the block size in bytes for this cipher.

      • operatesBytewise

        boolean operatesBytewise()
        Returns true, if the cipher operates byte-wise. False otherwise.

      • operatesNibblewise

        boolean operatesNibblewise()
        Returns true, if the cipher operates nibble-wise. False otherwise.

      • operatesColumnwise

        boolean operatesColumnwise()
        Returns true, if the cipher operates byte-wise and column-wise. False otherwise.

      • setKey

        void setKey(ByteArray key)
        Sets the secret key used for encryption and decryption. Internally, the cipher will be expected to check if the size of the given key is correct, and run the key schedule.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySizeError - The key size is invalid.

      • setExpandedKey

        void setExpandedKey(ByteArray expandedKey)
        Sets the expanded key with all round keys. Internally, the cipher will be expected to check if the size of the given key is correct. This method will explicitly not run the key schedule.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeySizeError - The key size is invalid.
